definition: sail/Taiwan pr. [fan2], except 帆布[fan1 bu4] canvas
ordinary/commonplace/mundane/temporal/of the material world (as opposed to supernatural or immortal levels)/every/all/whatever/altogether/gist/outline/note of Chinese musical scale
propitious wind throughout the journey (idiom)/plain sailing/to go smoothly/have a nice trip!
Zhang Chunfan (-1935), late Qing novelist, author of The Nine-tailed Turtle 九尾龜|九尾龟

sentences.english: By linking Micro-computer and the 721-Spectrophotometre together, the automatic operation of the 721-Spectrophotometre is realized.
sentences.chinese: 介紹了利用微型計算機與721型訂光光度汁相聯帆。

sentences.english: On a mainsail, the luff attaches to the mast.
sentences.chinese: 在一面主帆上，帆前緣被連接到桅杆上。

sentences.english: The ship, with sails set, was moving now towards the deep water.
sentences.chinese: 那船張起了帆，正在向深水區移動。

sentences.english: The rig is one mast and two sails.
sentences.chinese: 這種船上有一根桅杆和兩面帆。

sentences.english: The wind and rain buffeted the sails.
He unstepped the mast and furled the sail and tied it.
sentences.chinese: 他拔下桅杆，把帆捲起，繫住。

sentences.english: How would you like to have one of them skysails round your neck?
sentences.chinese: 你願意摘下一個天帆戴在你的脖子上嗎？

sentences.english: The large number of sails the Flying Cloud could carry increased the speed of the ship.
sentences.chinese: 帆大量的飛行雲，可進行船舶的速度增加。

sentences.english: Snakeskin Sail - Catch a breeze with this fancy new sail.
sentences.chinese: 蛇皮帆趕上微風這個奇特的新帆。

sentences.english: Sails are airfoils that work by using an airflow set up by the wind and the motion of the boat.
sentences.chinese: 帆是翼型的工作使用氣流所設立風和運動船。

sentences.english: A sail, such as a jib, set forward of a foremast.
sentences.chinese: 船首帆如三角帆等安裝前桅前方的帆。

sentences.english: They strained at the ropes to balance the sails.
sentences.chinese: 他們用力拉得繩子以保持帆的平衡。

sentences.english: Probably was so masted when she set forth.
sentences.chinese: 在她啓程時，大概桅杆直立，帆完全扯起。

sentences.english: The wind swelled out the sails .
We discerned a sail on the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 我們看見了地平線上的一張帆。

sentences.english: At the rain's edge, a sail.

definition: to set sail/to brave the waves
to travel a great distance by sea or air/voyage/long-haul flight
to ride the wind/to use a fair wind/to take an opportunity
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
